image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Billions more will be committed to building new homes in next week’s federal budget, as the government chases a promise to build 1.2 million new homes by the end of the decade.

title.children: Government to tip billions more into housing in next week’s federal budget

image.altText: The Earth is seen almost fully illuminated by the Sun against the pitch black of Space.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has warned level G4 (severe) geomagnetic storm conditions are expected to arrive at Earth from about 8pm AEST on Friday.

title.children: BOM warns severe geomagnetic storm is expected to impact Earth

image.altText: a design of a three-storey building in the tropics

props.synopsis: For years, Charles Darwin University has been lobbying for funding to establish its own medical school in the Northern Territory. That dream will now become reality.

title.children: The NT's first locally-run medical school gets green light, with Indigenous health a key focus

image.altText: A police wagon parked on a cordoned-off street where az dark-coloured car is lying on its roof.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old who was allegedly inside a car that crashed and killed another young man earlier this year will remain in custody ahead of his next court date.

title.children: No bail for teen allegedly in car involved in deadly Alice Springs crash

image.altText: A shot of coastal cliffs with some wild forest above.

props.synopsis: The unauthorised boat was detected in Australian waters early on Thursday morning after the vessel was destroyed by bad weather. Those on board were taken to Christmas Island before being transferred elsewhere.

title.children: Boat carrying 33 suspected asylum seekers intercepted in Australian waters

image.altText: The High Court on the shores of Lake Burley Griffin. There are dark clouds over the building, and a seagull in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The High Court dismisses a case brought by an Iranian man demanding to be released from immigration detention after refusing to cooperate with efforts to deport him.

title.children: High Court sides with government in case of Iranian man resisting deportation

image.altText: A white teenage boy with fair hair and Down syndrome sitting on the ground

props.synopsis: Remembering their son Finlay brings smiles to his parents' faces — but the pain of losing him to what they believe was a preventable death is undeniable.

title.children: 'Kick in the guts': The death certificate detail that made the loss of Finlay Browne even more painful

image.altText: Nat Fyfe and Alex Pearce in tears during tribute

props.synopsis: Fremantle stars Nat Fyfe and Alex Pearce were overcome with emotion as they observed a minute's silence in memory of former teammate Cam McCarthy prior to a heavy loss to Sydney on Friday night.

title.children: McCarthy's old teammates brought to tears during emotional tribute as Swans down Dockers

image.altText: Photo illustration of Bruce Lehrmann with wood panelling and Australian emblem of Federal Court in Sydney in the background.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders Bruce Lehrmann to pay Network Ten’s costs of defending his failed defamation case over the interview with Brittany Higgins on The Project.

title.children: Judge finds Lehrmann should pay costs 'on an indemnity basis' for most of defamation case, as it happened

image.altText: Tristed metal and tin on the partially collapsed PCYC building in Bunbury

props.synopsis: Two people are rushed to hospital after a tornado smashes through Bunbury on Friday afternoon.

title.children: Two hospitalised as tornado rips through WA's south west, tearing off roofs and damaging property

image.altText: Penny Wong at a press conference standing in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Australia is leaning towards supporting a resolution to extend Palestinians' rights as a United Nations observer, sources have told the ABC.

title.children: Australia leans towards supporting resolution extending Palestinians' rights as United Nations observer

image.altText: Riders at the 2016 Redback mountain bike event, Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: The $12 million Red Centre Adventure Ride near Alice Springs is a "dead duck" due to years of failed negotiations between the NT government and traditional owners of the land.

title.children: Brakes put on mountain bike trail after NT government fails to meet agreement with traditional owners

image.altText: Two hands hold a piggy bank full of coins.

props.synopsis: The government promises cost-of-living relief in next week's budget, including tax cuts, but a NAB survey suggests as many as a third of taxpayers will simply squirrel it away.

title.children: A third of taxpayers likely to squirrel stage 3 tax cuts away, major bank survey shows

image.altText: Cam MCarthy raises his right hand in celebration as he runs across the football ground.

props.synopsis: Former Fremantle and Greater Western Sydney forward Cam McCarthy dies after being found unresponsive at a home in Perth's south — the fourth tragic death among ex-Dockers players in recent years.

title.children: 'This is unbelievably sad': Former AFL player Cam McCarthy dead at 29

image.altText: An aerial view of the plant with numerous chimneys and steam coming out of them

props.synopsis: The boss of Orica, a major explosives manufacturer that relies on gas, says the federal government's gas strategy won't assist what remains of Australia's manufacturing industry unless it caps prices at globally competitive levels.

title.children: Australia is a major gas exporter, but it's cheaper for this local manufacturer to get it in the US

image.altText: Convicted child sex offender Allan Hopkins.

props.synopsis: Police are calling for public assistance after a convicted child rapist who is facing new serious sex offence allegations, has fled South Australia.

title.children: SA, QLD police search for convicted child rapist accused of new serious sex offence

image.altText: Sakshi Agrawal wearing a white suit holding a phone to her ear.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne driver who fled the scene after hitting a woman boarding a tram and later blamed the crash on her Tesla's autopilot feature has been jailed.

title.children: Driver who panicked and fled after hitting pedestrian boarding tram jailed by Victorian court

image.altText: Matthew Dickerson speaking in front of a microphone

props.synopsis: The alleged incident occurred during a karaoke afterparty involving Japanese officials from the town of Minokamo and a visiting delegation from the New South Wales town of Dubbo.

title.children: 'I was drunk': Japanese official accused of inappropriate behaviour to visiting daughter of Australian mayor

image.altText: A bulldozer rips up rows of vines.

props.synopsis: Too much wine might not seem like a problem, but take a drive through Australian wine country and you'll quickly see how a global glut has created a crisis.

title.children: Younger people aren't drinking wine, and there's too much for sale

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: The jury in the murder trial of former Jetstar pilot Greg Lynn over the deaths of Carol Clay and Russell Hill has been discharged, less than 24 hours after it was empanelled.

title.children: Victorian campers murder trial jury discharged moments before opening arguments

image.altText: A boy sitting near a garden

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has confirmed it's pulling funding from three youth hubs in Alice Springs town camps.

title.children: Youth hubs scrapped in Alice Springs, amid claims they 'aren't hitting the mark'

image.altText: GPS tracker on an ankle with person wearing a black shoe.

props.synopsis: Less than half of the 153 former immigration detainees released into the community after a High Court ruling last year are subject to electronic monitoring and curfews, the federal government says.

title.children: The government passed a law last year to put ankle bracelets on released detainees. Only half have to wear them

image.altText: A photo of a person in an online meeting with the person's head is blurred.

props.synopsis: The ANU has promised to take swift action if an investigation finds Nazi gestures were used at an online students' association meeting this week.

title.children: Australian National University investigating if Nazi gestures were used at student association meeting

image.altText: An older man in a coat speaks into a microphone on marble steps in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Robert F Kennedy Jr struggled with memory loss and brain fog so severe his friends were concerned he had a tumour. Instead, he says, doctors found a parasite.

title.children: Robert F Kennedy says a worm 'ate a portion' of his brain, 'then died'. What can a brain parasite do?

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks at a microphone with an American flag behind him.

props.synopsis: As the US president threatens to pull back on his support for Israel, his election opponent makes headlines for very different reasons as Stormy Daniels appears in court.

title.children: Biden's red line, Trump's make-or-break moment and a brain worm: US politics takes some unusual turns

image.altText: A man with short grey hair and a green plaid shirt gives the camera a half smile.

props.synopsis: A father-of-two from Victoria has his world turned upside down by an immigration law repealed in 2002. When he spoke to the ABC, the Department of Immigration changed its tune.

title.children: Australian man stunned to find out he lost his citizenship 33 years ago due to now-defunct law

image.altText: Side-profile mid-close-up of a white man in a light blue collared shirt, walking past a big news camera.

props.synopsis: Mr Wright is facing a criminal charge relating to the aftermath of a helicopter crash which killed his Netflix co-star in 2022. Whether that will go to a trial is now unknown.

title.children: Netflix star Matt Wright's lawyers in bid to avoid 'full-blown jury trial' over charge

image.altText: Two purple and white planes on a tarmac, seen through a chainlink fence.

props.synopsis: Administrators say up to 20 parties are interested in saving the embattled airline as large debts are revealed at the first creditors' meeting.

title.children: Bonza administrators tell creditors they are hopeful airline can be saved despite $116m debt

image.altText: Anthony Monteleone, who has been accused of stabbing his former girlfriend outside a south Sydney gym

props.synopsis: Anthony Monteleone, 45, will remain behind bars after facing a Sydney court where it was revealed an  apprehended domestic violence order did not stop him from making contact and following her.

title.children: Man accused of stabbing ex-girlfriend in Sydney car park made 'repeated' attempts to contact her, court told

image.altText: Man holds sign saying 'real men stand with women' among other protesters at the violence against women rally in Sydney.

props.synopsis: All men can play a role in shifting the harmful beliefs and culture that drives violence against women. Experts explain how.

title.children: How men can help prevent violence against women, starting today

image.altText: Maira Cappiello

props.synopsis: Maira Cappiello says she felt alone despite being in the centre of town when the alleged assault occurred on Wednesday morning.

title.children: 'I was screaming ... no one cared': Woman sexually assaulted by 10yo felt alone

image.altText: close up of side of Scott Morrison's face

props.synopsis: Former prime minister Scott Morrison said he wanted a woman to replace him in the very safe seat of Cook. What happened instead has been described as "blatant, arrogant and overt" — a concerted campaign driven by some of the country's most influential figures.

title.children: A prime minister's seat up for grabs, the backlash in the battle for Cook

image.altText: A young girl is silhouetted against fading evening sun holding a football in one hand while walking across sand dune ridge

props.synopsis: In the shadow of Uluru, an unprecedented football carnival was quietly held for young First Nations women from remote communities. More than sport was at play.

title.children: Hidden from view, a remarkable football carnival took place near Uluru

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 closed higher on Friday after the Bank of England kept interest rates steady and US indices lifted on Thursday night.

title.children: ASX closes in positive territory after Bank of England holds rates steady — as it happened
